column4: I've got a gripe with apt pkg manager, often times `apt-get install somepackage`, and _nowhere_ is it indicated in the install scroll what the actual cmdline name for invoking somepackage.  Is there a flag available to force apt-get emit the command name?
you can apt-cache search SOME-COMPONENT and it will tell you the full package name... not sure if that's what you mean.
a package might be named "foo" and the program has path /usr/bin/bar    nowhere does the installed say "To run program foo you must type $bar"
- dpkg -L program       it will show you the path to /bin and the prog name
